column5: caught this guy tonight along with another one that was 4.5 pounds.   Caught 11 smallies in two hours...pretty good night  http://i845.photobucket.com/albums/ab12/drock6687/DSCF0078.jpg
Nice bass, congrats on a PB
Yes never give a weight just measurements in inches if you give a weight people are going to dump all over you. That being said nice fish.
What if the OP is 6'6"?..........That would make it at least 5lbs i would guess.  Nice lookin smallie bud !!!!
Very nice!!
Good looking Smallie........congrats !
Congrats on a very nice fish. That was a good evening of fishing for sure. Thanks for sharing.

Nice catch...  I'm a big guy and my fish never look their real size... I have a pic with a 7.5lb smallie but it looks like a 4-5 pounder... It's frustrating...  That's why I fish with smaller friends of mine...lol... Makes the fish look huge...
Also, to make it look bigger in the photo, hold it out away from your body......it does wonders for fish photos!!!
Congrats on a gorgeous fish!
Beauty fish.
Great fish!
Congrats on the PB!
Real dark fish. You were fishing a river?  Nice fish.
That's what it looked like didn't it?. Tell us where!!lol.just kidding.
Come on now,we dont want to know where,just what did you use?
You didn't see the lol,.I think he knows better.lol.
Nice fish dude, i also like your style. Holding it nice and close to your body to show the true size of the fish.

I saw the photo and thought the fish looked like 2.5 or 3 lbs I decided to show how small it was to my surprise it is a lot bigger then I thought ok the average man measures 2.8" between centers of his eyes so I did the math nice fish
Your too funny Terry,thanks for the chuckle.
yeppers it was in a river,  i think it was just hanging out in some weeds then just came out to feed.  Caught on a rapalla Cracklin Crank,  my favorite bass lure expect the $12 price tag each
Very nice fish, and Terry you've got waaay too much time on your hands.

Nice fish. Love its colours. Reminds me a smallies from the west arm.  I guess that is why they are called black bass. I once caught a 5.2 pound largie and I didn't post its weight because it looked like a 3.5 pound fish.
